meanings.definition: To disconnect or separate from something
meanings.sent1: I need to dissociate the cables carefully to avoid any damage.
meanings.sent2: She decided to dissociate herself from the toxic relationship.
meanings.sent3: The magician tried to dissociate the two rings but ended up linking them together.
meanings.sent4: His mind seemed to dissociate from reality as he delved into the book.
meanings.sent5: The astronaut had to dissociate from the spacecraft before reentry.

meanings.definition: To disassociate oneself from a group or organization
meanings.sent1: He wanted to dissociate from the club due to its controversial activities.
meanings.sent2: She chose to dissociate herself from the political party after the scandal.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to dissociate from the other pets by hiding in the closet.
meanings.sent4: The employee decided to dissociate from the company to pursue his own business.
meanings.sent5: The student had to dissociate from the study group to focus on her own project.

meanings.definition: To mentally detach or separate oneself from a situation or experience
meanings.sent1: He needed to dissociate from the stressful thoughts to relax.
meanings.sent2: She tried to dissociate herself from the traumatic memories of the accident.
meanings.sent3: The comedian used humor to dissociate from the embarrassing situation.
meanings.sent4: The artist could dissociate from reality while immersed in painting.
meanings.sent5: The meditation helped her dissociate from the chaos of daily life.
